page.title: 06Ulverston's Market Stalls
page.content: There has been a steady growth of the street market in Ulverston;it now occupies{3 streets}rather than one,and is held on{2 days}instead of one.This has led to increased competition bet- ween stalls and a reduction in profit for some. Stallholders also complain that the recent introduction of car park charges has led to a decline in their takings. In spite of these drawbacks,it appears that little can affect the spirit of these traders, as many of the stalls have been in the same family for half a century,and many of the traders are prepared to travel from Lancashire and beyond. Customers think that Ulverston is a friendly market and has a wide variety of stalls including fresh fish,fruit, vegetables,clothing and hardware.
